{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lip line is described based on the position of the lips in relation to the upper incisors when the mouth is at rest. An average lip line is when the lips are at the level of the tips of the upper incisors. A high lip line is when more than the full length of the maxillary incisors and some gingival tissue are visible. A low lip line is when less than the full length of the maxillary incisors is visible. In this case, the lip line is opposite the tips of the upper incisors, which is described as an average lip line.", "answer_choice": "A"}
